Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I am not sure if it is intentional, but the clusters section doesn't indicate that it enables Antara modules.

Is it possible to change the section name to "Antara Modules"
and add the options N=0 and N=1 too ? (for the cases: disable antara modules and enable antara modules but disable crosschain stuff)

Also the description of "Non-fungible" case should have: "less than 100"
and "fungible" case should have: "greater than 99"
https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-setup/antara-customizations.html#summary-of-ac-cc
@ca333 @naezith

Author: naezith#9757
Content: someone please review and take the final decisions, I will do the changes then

Author: ca333#0118
Content: yes - lets orientate towards https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/antara/antara-setup/antara-customizations.html#ac-cc and gcharangs suggestion @naezith - @Alright can you please help us with the review once this is done.

Content:
did these two changes:
- change CLUSTERS  to ANTARA MODULES
- description of "Non-fungible" case should have: "less than 100"  "fungible" case should have: "greater than 99"

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if the chain is meant to be fungible with others, it requires dpow and the number must be reserved

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so like if one customer makes ac_cc=312 chain, no other chains can use 312 unless that customer allows it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 0 should not be a valid value btw, that is the equivalent of not setting ac_cc at all

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@naezith 

my suggestion is:

```
Section name: Antara modules

Show 3 options
- Antara modules disabled ---> don't include  "-ac_cc" in the chain params at all
- Antara modules enabled but no crosschain validation ---> "-ac_cc=1" (a chain that doesn't want to scale at all)
- Antara modules enabled and crosschain validation is also enabled.
  |   If this case is selected, then show these two sub options
  | - non-fungible case ---> "-ac_cc=N" N >= 2 and <= 99 (chains that can interact with other chains to create some complex logic like fitbit tokens transfering to a insurance chain to activate an Antara module)
  | - fungible case ---> "-ac_cc=N" N >= 100 (chains that can scale and increase their txn/sec)
```
@Alright can you confirm the above description is correct?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's correct

Author: Alright#0419
Content: nothing really uses momom over than burn protocol right now, so 2-99 is just future proofing

Author: naezith#9757
Content: okay I can do the changes, do you approve @ca333 ?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
  | - non-fungible case ---> "-ac_cc=N" N >= 2 and <= 99 (chains that can interact with other chains to create some complex logic like fitbit tokens transfering to a insurance chain to activate an Antara module)
  | - fungible case ---> "-ac_cc=N" N >= 100 (chains that can scale and increase their txn/sec)
```
@gcharang @naezith maybe mention this requires dpow

Author: naezith#9757
Content: current system does not check if dpow is in same cart

Author: naezith#9757
Content: since dpow is added after all these stuff are selected

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@naezith if the third option 
```
Antara modules enabled and crosschain validation is also enabled.
```
is selected, mention there that subscribing to dPoW is mandatory in the selection screen

Later in the cart, if the user tries to go to the Payment screen without adding dPoW, throw an error saying "either select dPoW or go back to change the Antara module to the `-ac_cc=1` case"?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's a weird situation because nothing actually uses momom right now other than burn protocol

Author: Alright#0419
Content: a default value of ac_cc=2 would work for 99% of people

Author: Alright#0419
Content: practically, there is no difference between ac_cc=1 and ac_cc=2 right now

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the reserving any ac_cc value >99 is vitally important btw

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so if you can't do that right now, wouldn't support >99 for now

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Let's say Alice makes new coin with ac_cc=101, if Bob can create another ac_cc=101 chain and have it added to the same dpow network, Bob can make millions of coins on his chain and import them to Alice's
